Events.Text: <i>I found my place at one of the empty cooking stations,░ ready to listen to Remy's instructions.

Events.Text: Okay class,░ listen up!

Events.Text: Okay, everyone!░ We're going to be discussing the best way to make a traditional ragù alla bolognese,░ which is the fancy way to say a traditional pasta sauce from Bologna in Italy.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: Now there's many different versions of this dish,░ and we've only got so many practice ingredients here,░ but I'll talk you through the variations when we come to them.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: The key ingredients,░ besides the herbs of course,░ are the combination of tomatoes, ground beef, onions and carrots.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text:
And, hehe,░ yes, I know...░ Bunny and carrots, it's just how this recipe is!░ 
I'll be going around giving some tips as we go through,░ but for the most part you're going to be on your own here!░ This is a pretty simple recipe and you're likely to have made something like it before!
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: First off,░ like so many recipes,░ we want to soften up the onion and garlic.░ You should have these portioned out for you.░ At home,░ I like to use mix of yellow and red onions, personally,░ about one medium sized one of each and a few extra garlic cloves.░ We've just got a large white onion here for today,░ we only have so many ingredients in the budget, of course,░ but you can adjust these to taste at home!
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: <i>The way she took charge of the lesson was adorable.░ Remy seemed to light up when she was talking about cooking,░ a passion that she seemed a little too shy to share with just anyone outside of the kitchen.
Events.Title: %playername%

Events.Text: Remember to heat the oil first,░ but to a low heat when making this at home,░ a trick I learned from Indian cooking is that the slower you cook the onions the better they taste!░ I personally like a finely chopped garlic and strips of onion about an eighth of an inch by an inch.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: Typically we'd also add in a few spices at this point too,░ to bring out the flavors when heating the onions and garlic.░ Allspice, pepper, cinnamon and cloves.░ You would add bay leaves at this stage too.░ We don't have those with us today at your station.░ We'll be making a basic version here.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: <i>It made sense that she was giving the variations for the other students,░ and some of them were pulling out the extras they had brought with them,░ I'd have to make do with what they had here.
Events.Title: %playername%

Events.Text: When the onions are starting to brown,░ that's when we'll be turning up the heat and adding in the ground beef,░ trying not to break it up too much as it cooks so it keeps some of its consistency.░
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: It's common in Europe to add a beef bouillon cube or Worcestershire sauce in at this point to infuse the meat.░ And you can even use honey bourbon or wine,░ like you do in a chili.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: When the meat is browned we'll be adding in a couple of grated carrots.░ That's before the tomato sauce so the carrot juices can mix with the core flavors and reduce down a little without compromising the tomato flavor.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: The tradition of adding carrots is often cut out of simple ragù,░ but it makes a good pairing to beef,░ especially with the addition of cinnamon and citrus elements.░ It also pairs great with the spice combination in a cottage pie,░ and it brings a good color profile to most dishes.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: <i>It was honestly great to see her so animated and in her element,░ she lit up in a way that was a little distracting in comparison to the shy girl hiding by the railings at Amorous.░ She bounced cutely on her heels as she recited the recipe from memory.
Events.Title: %playername%

Events.Text:
After the carrots are heated through and the juices are coming together,░ we'll be adding in our tomatoes.░
Typically you want to use a large can of chopped tomatoes for about a pound or so of beef,░ depending on the water and fat content.░ You'll also want to add in a small can of tomato puree,░ or a third a tube of the paste.░
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: You can chop up your own tomatoes too,░ which gives a more rustic mouth feel,░ though a smoother sauce requires peeling your tomatoes first.░ If you can manage it, at home,░ I always recommend keeping your tomatoes by the window in a fruit bowl.░ Even a ripe tomato is still maturing in flavor and the extra sun exposure adds to the taste!
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: You want to bring the sauce to temperature and give it time to soften up the meat a little and mix in with the oils from our other ingredients.░ You're looking at about a 20 minutes slow simmer, the first half with the lid on.░ I've known traditional recipes to reduce a higher water content sauce for hours and you'd need more time for fresh-cut raw tomatoes.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text:
<i>Remy was moving a little fast for me,░ I wasn't exactly a stranger to the kitchen but I wished I'd brought a notepad to take notes.░ 
Onions first... Meat... simple enough.░
Events.Title: %playername%

Events.Text: Early on in this process we'd be adding in any dried herbs,░ a typical Italian mix will work fine.░ If you don't know that's three parts oregano to every two parts thyme and marjoram and every one part basil, rosemary and sage.░ If you're mixing from all dried ingredients you can take that as a teaspoon guide, though, personally,░ I like to use a little less sage and rosemary.░
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: For today we'll be using fresh herbs,░ which you add in later, when this sauce is almost done.░ Keep an eye on the sauce, you don't want it to get too thick and stick!░ We've got fresh basil, thyme and oregano here.░ The portions should be measured out for you,░ but you want a similar balance to what I said before.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: Remember that large leafed herbs need to be chopped lightly so you don't lose the flavor to the chopping board.░ Small, woodier herbs like thyme and rosemary can be chopped finer and keep their flavor.░ If you can get a lemon thyme plant from your local nursery,░ I find the flavor a good addition here.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: We'll be adding in the fresh herbs with five minutes to go on the sauce,░ and you would typically keep a few basil and oregano leaves for garnish with a freshly grated parmesan.░
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: There are variants of the sauce I mentioned earlier that I would strongly consider if you have the ingredients to hand.░ I find the sauce improved by two sticks of cinnamon put in at the onion phase and some seasoning mixed in at the beef stage like Worcestershire sauce or even a small amount of extra puree to help bind the spices to the meat.░
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: When you would add in the dry herbs,░ I also usually squeeze in the juice of half a lemon,░ the citrus working very well with oregano,░ something we covered the other week in Greek cooking!
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: <i>Greek cooking, Indian influences?░ Remy seemed to really know her stuff!
Events.Title: %playername%

Events.Text: A more traditional bolognese would also use cream near the end, about half a cup,░ and cubed bacon or pancetta in with the rest of the meat.░ You can use milk for a lighter sauce or condensed cream of tomato soup for sweetness.░
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: It's also worth noting that the most traditional sauce from this region would be paired with pasta shells or tagliatelle,░ not spaghetti.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: In a home setting many recipes recommend to use about a half cup of Marsala wine,░ though personally I think any more than a splash into the meat when it's cooking overpowers the tomato and carrot profile.░ Also, hehe...░ they certainly wouldn't let us budget in bottles of wine for the night course.
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text:
And that's everything you need to know for now!░ 
I'll be hovering around,░ but we're looking at a pretty easy recipe today!░ Keep an eye on your pans,░ we won't be chopping any meat today, so we can work off one chopping board,░ but let's remember our hygiene lessons, especially with the ground beef!
Events.Title: Remy

Events.Text: Phew... Okay...░ here goes nothing then!
Events.Title: %playername%
